Class KeyManager

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.managers.KeyManager
public class KeyManager extends Object
Manages keyboard input handling for the application.

This class acts as an Input Adapter/Controller. It intercepts raw JavaFX KeyEvents, determines if they are valid based on the current game state (Running, Paused, Game Over), and maps them to specific logical actions.

It routes system-level commands (Pause, Mute, New Game) to the GuiController and gameplay commands (Move, Rotate, Drop) to the InputEventListener (the Model).

    • KeyManager

      public KeyManager(GuiController guiController, GameLoopManager gameLoopManager)
      Constructs a new KeyManager.
      Parameters:
      guiController - reference to the GUI for UI-level actions (Pause, Restart).
      gameLoopManager - reference to check the current game state (Paused, Countdown).

  • Method Details

    • setEventListener

      public void setEventListener(InputEventListener eventListener)
      Sets the listener that will receive gameplay-related commands. This is typically the main GameController.
      Parameters:
      eventListener - the logic component listening for moves.

    • handleInput

      public void handleInput(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent keyEvent)
      The central handler for all keyboard events.

      This method executes a hierarchy of checks:

      1. Global Toggles (Pause 'P', Mute 'M') - Always active.
      2. State Blocks - Ignores input if counting down.
      3. Menu Shortcuts - Allows 'N' for New Game even if Game Over.
      4. Gameplay Controls - Maps WASD/Arrows to movement only if the game is running.

      Parameters:
      keyEvent - the raw key event from JavaFX.
